class.name: Blas

javadoc.text:
* Subset of the BLAS (Basic Linear Algebra System); * High quality "building block" routines for performing basic vector and matrix operations. * Because the BLAS are efficient, portable, and widely available, they're commonly used in the development * of high quality linear algebra software. *

* Mostly for compatibility with legacy notations. Most operations actually just delegate to the appropriate * methods directly defined on matrices and vectors.

*

* This class implements the BLAS functions for operations on matrices from the * matrix package. It follows the spirit of the Draft Proposal for Java BLAS Interface, * by Roldan Pozo of the National Institute of Standards and Technology. Interface * definitions are also identical to the Ninja interface. Because the matrix package * supports sections, the interface is actually simpler.

*

Currently, the following operations are supported:

*
    *
  1. BLAS Level 1: Vector-Vector operations
    2. *
      *
    • ddot : dot product of two vectors
      • *
    • daxpy : scalar times a vector plus a vector
      • *
    • drotg : construct a Givens plane rotation
      • *
    • drot : apply a plane rotation
      • *
    • dcopy : copy vector X into vector Y
      • *
    • dswap : interchange vectors X and Y
      • *
    • dnrm2 : Euclidean norm of a vector
      • *
    • dasum : sum of absolute values of vector components
      • *
    • dscal : scale a vector by a scalar
      • *
    • idamax: index of element with maximum absolute value
      • *
    *
  2. 2.BLAS Level 2: Matrix-Vector operations
    3. *
      *
    • dgemv : matrix-vector multiply with general matrix
      • *
    • dger : rank-1 update on general matrix
      • *
    • dsymv : matrix-vector multiply with symmetric matrix
      • *
    • dtrmv : matrix-vector multiply with triangular matrix
      • *
    *
  3. 3.BLAS Level 3: Matrix-Matrix operations *
      *
    • dgemm : matrix-matrix multiply with general matrices
      • *
    *
    4. *
javadoc.author: wolfgang.hoschek@cern.ch

javadoc.text: Assigns the result of a function to each cell; <tt>x[row,col] = function(x[row,col])</tt>.
javadoc.param: function a function object taking as argument the current cell's value.

javadoc.text: Assigns the result of a function to each cell; <tt>x[row,col] = function(x[row,col],y[row,col])</tt>.
javadoc.param: y the secondary matrix to operate on.
function a function object taking as first argument the current cell's value of <tt>this</tt>, * and as second argument the current cell's value of <tt>y</tt>,

javadoc.text: Returns the sum of absolute values; <tt>|x[0]| + |x[1]| + ... </tt>. * In fact equivalent to <tt>x.aggregate(cern.jet.math.Functions.plus, cern.jet.math.Functions.abs)</tt>.
Combined vector scaling; <tt>y = y + alpha*x</tt>. * In fact equivalent to <tt>y.assign(x,cern.jet.math.Functions.plusMult(alpha))</tt>.
javadoc.param: y the second source vector, this is also the vector where results are stored.

javadoc.text: Combined matrix scaling; <tt>B = B + alpha*A</tt>. * In fact equivalent to <tt>B.assign(A,cern.jet.math.Functions.plusMult(alpha))</tt>.
javadoc.param: B the second source matrix, this is also the matrix where results are stored.

javadoc.text: Vector assignment (copying); <tt>y = x</tt>. * In fact equivalent to <tt>y.assign(x)</tt>.
Matrix assignment (copying); <tt>B = A</tt>. * In fact equivalent to <tt>B.assign(A)</tt>.
Returns the dot product of two vectors x and y, which is <tt>Sum(x[i]*y[i])</tt>. * In fact equivalent to <tt>x.zDotProduct(y)</tt>.

Generalized linear algebraic matrix-matrix multiply; C = alpha*A*B + beta*C. * In fact equivalent to A.zMult(B,C,alpha,beta,transposeA,transposeB). * Note: Matrix shape conformance is checked after potential transpositions.
javadoc.param: transposeA set this flag to indicate that the multiplication shall be performed on A'.
transposeB set this flag to indicate that the multiplication shall be performed on B'.
C the third source matrix, this is also the matrix where results are stored.

javadoc.text: Generalized linear algebraic matrix-vector multiply; y = alpha*A*x + beta*y. * In fact equivalent to A.zMult(x,y,alpha,beta,transposeA). * Note: Matrix shape conformance is checked after potential transpositions.
javadoc.param: transposeA set this flag to indicate that the multiplication shall be performed on A'.
y the second source vector, this is also the vector where results are stored.

javadoc.text:
Performs a rank 1 update; A = A + alpha*x*y'. * Example: * 
 * A = { {6,5}, {7,6} }, x = {1,2}, y = {3,4}, alpha = 1 -->
 * A = { {9,9}, {13,14} }
 *
javadoc.param: A an m by n matrix.

javadoc.text: Return the 2-norm; <tt>sqrt(x[0]^2 + x[1]^2 + ...)</tt>. * In fact equivalent to <tt>Math.sqrt(Algebra.DEFAULT.norm2(x))</tt>.
Applies a givens plane rotation to (x,y); <tt>x = c*x + s*y; y = c*y - s*x</tt>.
javadoc.param: c the cosine of the angle of rotation.
s the sine of the angle of rotation.

javadoc.text: Constructs a Givens plane rotation for <tt>(a,b)</tt>. * Taken from the LINPACK translation from FORTRAN to Java, interface slightly modified. * In the LINPACK listing DROTG is attributed to Jack Dongarra
javadoc.param: rotvec[] Must be at least of length 4. On output contains the values <tt>{a,b,c,s}</tt>.

javadoc.text: Vector scaling; <tt>x = alpha*x</tt>. * In fact equivalent to <tt>x.assign(cern.jet.math.Functions.mult(alpha))</tt>.
Matrix scaling; <tt>A = alpha*A</tt>. * In fact equivalent to <tt>A.assign(cern.jet.math.Functions.mult(alpha))</tt>.
Swaps the elements of two vectors; <tt>y <==> x</tt>. * In fact equivalent to <tt>y.swap(x)</tt>.
Swaps the elements of two matrices; <tt>B <==> A</tt>.

Symmetric matrix-vector multiplication; <tt>y = alpha*A*x + beta*y</tt>. * Where alpha and beta are scalars, x and y are n element vectors and * A is an n by n symmetric matrix. * A can be in upper or lower triangular format.
javadoc.param: isUpperTriangular is A upper triangular or lower triangular part to be used?
y the second vector holding source and destination.

javadoc.text: Triangular matrix-vector multiplication; <tt>x = A*x</tt> or <tt>x = A'*x</tt>. * Where x is an n element vector and A is an n by n unit, or non-unit, * upper or lower triangular matrix.
javadoc.param: isUpperTriangular is A upper triangular or lower triangular?
transposeA set this flag to indicate that the multiplication shall be performed on A'.
isUnitTriangular true --> A is assumed to be unit triangular; false --> A is not assumed to be unit triangular
x the vector holding source and destination.

javadoc.text: Returns the index of largest absolute value; <tt>i such that |x[i]| == max(|x[0]|,|x[1]|,...).</tt>.
javadoc.param: x the vector to search through.
javadoc.return: the index of largest absolute value (-1 if x is empty).
